item.title: The Make Up of Task Force Church During Operation Grenade
item.description: Go inside a pivotal moment of WWII. This video breaks down the composition of Task Force Church and explains how this unique group was assembled for Operation Grenade.

media:content.media:title: The Make Up of Task Force Church During Operation Grenade
media:content.media:description: Go inside a pivotal moment of WWII. This video breaks down the composition of Task Force Church and explains how this unique group was assembled for Operation Grenade.

item.title: The Battle of the Bulge Was By Far the Worst We Experienced
item.description: What was it like to fight in the Battle of the Bulge? This video is a first-hand account of the profound challenges a soldier faced in one of WWII’s toughest battles.

item.title: He Took Down an Entire Enemy Position: Medal of Honor!
item.description: What does it take to earn a Medal of Honor? We'll show you the powerful, true story of a soldier who took on an entire enemy position with his valiant actions to save his unit.

item.title: On this day in 1944, the amphibious assault on Peleliu (Code-named Operation Stalemate II) began.
item.description: On this day in 1944, the amphibious assault on Peleliu (Code-named Operation Stalemate II) began. The goal was to take out the Japanese airfields on the island to help protect the allies before an invasion of the Philippines. Despite the island only being 6 miles long and 2 miles wide, the intense fighting led to 9,800 casualties. WWII Marine Bill Finnegan was there to experience it all.

item.title: Why You Never Want Clouds Under You in Combat
item.description: Why You Never Want Clouds Under You in Combat

item.title: Navy SEAL Marcus Luttrell, who was the lone survivor of Operation Red Wings, explains what Americans should know about
item.description: Navy SEAL Marcus Luttrell, who was the lone survivor of Operation Red Wings, explains what Americans should know about his friend and Commanding Officer Mike Murphy. For the past 28 years the AVC has brought together dozens of notable veterans of the last 80 years of history for our Annual Veterans Conference, where they share their lessons and experiences with an audience of several hundred students from each of the military service academies & ROTC programs from across the country. Participants range from surviving heroes of WWII to recipients of the Medal of Honor to young Special Operations veterans of today’s military. The weekend of programming concludes with American Valor: A Salute to Our Heroes, a black-tie gala filmed as a Veterans Day television special, airing on ABC, CBS, NBC and Fox stations across the country, and to all military personnel around the world on American Forces Network. We look forward to our 28th Annual Conference & Gala this coming November!

item.title: How To Get Out of a Sherman Tank Quickly
item.description: the steps needed to safely and quickly exit a Sherman tank in a critical situation.

item.title: B-17 Navigator Reflects on Targeting Berlin During D-Day
item.description: In this powerful account, a B-17 navigator shares his personal story of a challenging WWII mission. He reflects on his service and the experiences that shaped his time during the war.

item.title: Bailing Out of a Burning Aircraft Over Vietnam
item.description: A veteran recounts a moment that would change his life forever. He tells the first-hand story of a close call and the courage it took to escape a damaged plane over Vietnam.

item.title: Shooting Down German Planes During WWII | Battle of the Bulge
item.description: This is a somber look at the skies over the Battle of the Bulge. A pilot details the courage required to defend against enemy planes during a pivotal moment of WWII.

item.title: WWII Veteran and 101st Airborne Paratrooper Guy Whidden shares a story
item.description: WWII Veteran and 101st Airborne Paratrooper Guy Whidden shares a story on how close soldiers were on the enemy lines when one man in his unit smoked a cigarette with an enemy German soldier unknowingly

item.title: The Benefit of Having a Geologist on the Moon
item.description: Learn why a geologist is a mission-critical crew member for lunar exploration. We'll show you how their expertise is vital for finding water, valuable minerals, and a safe landing site.

item.title: A firefighter's 9/11 story.
item.description: In this powerful account, NYC firefighter Tim Brown shares his first-hand experience from the Office of Emergency Management on 9/11. It's a solemn and emotional story of what he saw that day.

item.title: Trying to Repair a Damaged Aircraft Under Enemy Fire
item.description: Trying to Repair a Damaged Aircraft Under Enemy Fire

item.title: National Guard Operations Group Commander Marc Sasseville explains what air traffic control saw on radar with Flight 93
item.description: A commander explains the final moments of United Flight 93. He describes what was seen on radar during the last stages of the flight.

item.title: My Unthinkable Mission on 9/11 To Bring Down Flight 93
item.description: A pilot recounts the critical moments on 9/11 and the urgent directive he was given. This is a first-hand account of a difficult mission in an impossible situation.

item.title: Taking Care of a Rogue Truck to Keep Our Cover
item.description: This is the story of a truck that went rogue. We had to act fast to fix it and keep our operation running smoothly in a race against the clock.

item.title: B-17 Pilot's Heroic Move for Crew's Safety in WWII
item.description: A pilot faced a difficult choice in the skies of WWII. This is a first-hand account of the courageous move he made to protect his crew and bring them home.

item.title: Air Force Pilot Allison Black explains how she took out enemy targets.
item.description: In this powerful account, Air Force pilot Allison Black explains how she successfully executed a difficult mission. It’s a first-hand look at the precision and courage required in a combat environment.

item.title: Joseph Rodgers, a Marine who fought on the island of Iwo Jima in WWII, explains how the Japanese would rather die than surrender
item.description: In this powerful account, WWII veteran Joseph Rodgers shares his first-hand perspective on the Battle of Iwo Jima and the unyielding resolve of the Japanese soldiers he faced.
